question: Which nation has the highest tide in the world?
explanation: Canada has the highest tide in the world. The highest tides in the world can be found in Canada's Bay of Fundy, which separates New Brunswick of Canada from Nova Scotia of America. Canada's Bay of Fundy experiences increased or higher tidal ranges because of the constrictions of the oceans surrounding Canada due to the closeness of North America, Europe and Asia in the Northern Hemisphere.
